description: Antimutinous numbers: n>1 such that n/p^k < p, where p is the largest prime dividing n and p^k is the highest power of p dividing n.
links: Ivan Neretin, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
maple: A006530 := proc(n) local ifs ; if n = 1 then 1; else ifs := ifactors(n)[2] ; max(seq( op(1,k),k=ifs)) ; fi ; end: isA027855 := proc(n) local p,k,pk; if n <= 1 then false; else p := A006530(n) ; pk := p ; while n mod ( pk*p) = 0 do pk := pk*p ; od: if n< p*pk then true ; else false ; fi ; fi ; end: for n from 2 to 120 do if isA027855(n) then printf("%d, ",n) ; fi ; od: # _R. J. Mathar_, Dec 02 2007
author: _Leroy Quet_.
extensions: More terms from _R. J. Mathar_, Dec 02 2007
